meanings.definition: To move with a sloshing sound.
meanings.sent1: The water slished around in the bucket.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the slish of the waves against the shore.
meanings.sent3: The kids had fun slishing water at each other in the pool.
meanings.sent4: The rain slished down on the roof all night long.
meanings.sent5: The mud made a satisfying slish as I walked through it.

meanings.sent1: I love to drink a cold slish on a hot day.
meanings.sent2: The sidewalk was covered in a slippery slish after the snow melted.
meanings.sent3: The chef added a dollop of slish to the dessert for extra flavor.
meanings.sent4: The slish of ice and water made the roads dangerous to drive on.
meanings.sent5: The slish of the slushie machine was music to my ears.

meanings.sent1: The kids slished each other with water balloons.
meanings.sent2: The mud slished up onto my shoes as I walked through the puddle.
meanings.sent3: The paintbrush slished colorful patterns on the canvas.
meanings.sent4: The car drove through the puddle, slishing water everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The chef slished the sauce onto the plate with a flourish.
